39329596.review:
This game is basically a platforming bullet hell boss rush. There's only 7 main bosses and they're all very quick. In around 2 hours I completed the game twice (once on normal and another on very hard).

I really like the movement in this game. You can "dash" in any direction 3 times. You can also slow down time with an energy bar that refills over time. This creates multiple intense moments in the game which is awesome. Slowing down time and then dashing in order to escape multiple bullets in a tight area feels awesome. 

The bosses are all unique and well done as well. I particularly like the last stage, where it's a mega man style boss rush at the end. However, you face TWO of the same bosses at the same type (e.g. instead of 1 blob, you face 2). When I initially saw this I thought it was insane because the other bosses were no pushovers. However, to my surprise I only had a mildly difficult time with facing 2 at the same time. This goes to show that I really mastered the mechanics/bosses of the game, which created a nice sense of achievement. It also helped that these duplicates had less health than the originals :P.

The story is just a funny little thing thrown in. You're a girl who wants to be a the #1 hero, so she decided to KILL all the other heroes….. Then someone ELSE takes the credit, the girl beats him up, and the whole world thanks her because they HATE the guy cause they think he killed the heroes…… lol what the hell xD. Like I said, it's funny. Nothing deep, but funny.

Unfortunately, this game didn't AMAZE me. I found this really strange considering that I love Cuphead. After thinking on it for a while, I realized it was due to 2 things.

	1. The game is really short, so you don’t have the time to really MASTER the mechanics. You have time to get good at them but that's about it. When it takes only 1 hour to beat the entire game, that's understandable. This significantly diminishes the feeling of achievement you get from beating the game/bosses.
	2. This game is Cuphead Expert levels of speed, sometimes more, but the game doesn't require you to be all that good. That's because the game gives you plenty of health to make multiple mistakes. This caused me to quickly give up on trying to master certain sections because the speed of the game was just so damn high. The game did nothing to slowly grow me into the fast pace, so I often found myself "cheating". E.g. Sometimes I just dashed through an obstacle even if it cost me some health or to give up trying to dodge a boss's attack just so I keep shooting the boss and get more damage in. In Cuphead, I would freaking restart the level if I took 1 hit. That's because Cuphead did an excellent job of telegraphing all the moves and making everything feel "difficult but fair". This game just didn't hit the same sweet spot.

Regardless, this was a fun game. I genuinely enjoyed beating all of the stages.

37935075.review:
Comprei o jogo há muito tempo em uma promoção, por simples sobra de dinheiro na conta, e ele superou minhas expectativas. Eu não recomendo o jogo no preço original, porém é recomendadíssimo em qualquer promoção. Darei o resultado final da análise após os pros e contras.
[b] Pros do jogo:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Jogabilidade criativa, dinâmica e difícil, te dando uma experiência frenética e animada, com foco no prazer de se superar a cada vez.
    [*]Apesar de um story mode curto, o jogo oferece grande variedade de armas, dificuldades e modos para você continuamente tentar quebrar seu recorde.
    [*] Arte bem feita e história engraçada (citarei os contras da história abaixo), [spoiler]com créditos carinhosos ao jogador no final [/spoiler].
[/list]

[b] Contras do jogo[/b]
[list]
    [*]Apesar dos outros modos disponíveis, o story mode poderia ser maior e melhor desenvolvido, portanto não espere um jogo muito surpreendente ou com uma ótima história, ela é realmente BEM goofy.
    [*]PREÇO ALTO, considerando que nem todos que irão comprar o jogo se dedicarão em high scores, dificuldades e speedruns, a compra é apenas recomendada em promoção.
    [*] Só tem co-op local, limitando a diversão.
[/list]

[b] Resultado final [/b]
Não espere grandiosidades desse jogo, ele é um arcade digno desse nome, com foco em jogabilidade e diversão. História boba porém engraçada, jogabilidade divertida e difícil, como foco na mobilidade da personagem. Apesar de alguns RNG, é um jogo divertido para tentativas de speedrun, e garanto que caso você goste de auto superação em jogos difíceis, isso é pra você.

A simple, but fun side scroller shooter. Move and shoot in twin stick shooter style. The character can dash in all directions several times when she's in the air, so the movement is pretty fun too. You can also use bullet time to help you in combat. Pretty much like an over-the-top 2D retro version of Max Payne.
The negatives include that the game is not that great looking, and the sound effects can sound a little dull. Music is all right.

This was very cheap during a Steam sale, a little more than one euro in my area. For that price, I can recommend those who enjoy retro action games to check it out.

Note that this game also has a sequel here in Steam, I haven't played it yet, so I can't say anything about it yet.

PROS: The controls are fast and responsive and make you feel that most of the hits you take are your mistake.

CONS: The game is extremely short.

The reward for beating the game on very hard mode in story or easy mode in arcade okay, but I felt that there could have been more, maybe an extra level that focused on platforming.


To sum up, this game is a great game for the price, but will probably leave you wanting more out of it.

35355761.review:
Gameplay : 4/5
Sound and Music : 5/5
Visuals : 3/5
Replayability : 5/5
Story : 2/5

Overall : 3.8

Bleed is a really short, really fun game. The story is cute and all but doesn't really work with anything in the game besides 2 bosses and honestly it does detract from the game. If I think what my character is doing is stupid than I'm going to think the game is stupid. The visuals are fine but nothing has much depth to it. You can tell what's what but it's not pretty to look at it. The sound and music is great though with different audio cues for every action it seemed and plenty of tracks so the music doesn't get dull. The main story can be done in an hour but with different difficulties, challenges, and play styles this really adds to the replayability. The only problem with the gameplay is that there doesn't seem any use for some of the weapons over others and some unlockable weapons make previous weapons completely useless. I get you have to beat the game to use them but you can then use those weapons to help you beat the game on a higher difficulty so it just seems a little broken. Bleed is a good way to spend an hour or two though.

34250445.review:
[h1]Bueno, Bonito y Barato[/h1]

Pues este jueguito se puede considerar como un run n gun/twin stick shooter cuya mecanica principal es un "bullet time" (a la max payne) recargable que nuestra protagonista puede utilizar para salir de aprietos o evitar mucho daño.

>La historia:
Eres Wryn una  chica que busca cumplir su sueño de ser la mayor heroina del mundo, ♥ para ello tiene que enfrentarse a obstaculos (enemigos) formidables y probar su valia.

El juego consta de 7 stages muy bien logradas con bosses duales algunas veces, tienes 2 barritas una de vida y otra de bullet time, asi como 2 armas principales que puedes escojer a gusto, tienes wall jump y triple dash por lo que tienes que tener un poquito de skill y suerte a la hora de sortear obstaculos y balas.

>Lo bueno:
- El gameplay es fluido y bueno. Recuerda a los viejos contra(sin el instakill).
-Cada boss tiene su chiste, e incluso debilidad dependiendo el arma que ocupes.
-Desbloqueables(tanto de armas como barritas).
-Varios niveles de dificultad: desde easy para mancas como yo, hasta very hard para sadomasoquistas.
-El aspecto retro: da feels y nostalgia.

>Lo Malo:
-Su duracion (una hora maximo, lo cual se compensa con los desbloqueables)

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Pues... es un juego que cumple con las 3B's: esta Bueno, Bonito y Barato. El cual deberias darle una oportunidad.
Lo unico malo es su duracion, pero es un jueguito que entretiene y ademas el desarrollador es lindo: de los pocos que agradecen al jugador por jugar y darle oportunidad a su jueguito ♥

33490463.review:
[b][h1]I wanna be a hero[/h1][/b]

Grafikleri kötü olduğu için birçok oyuncu bu oyuna bakmadan direkt geçecektir, yüksek ihtimalle. Yine de oynanışı birçok oyundan daha hızlı ve beceri istiyor. Tabii, o kadar zor bir oyun değil fakat yine de beceri istemiyor değil. 

[b]Hikâye[/b]
Oyunda tatlı ve pembe saçlı bir karakterimiz var, kendisi Wryn ve halk tarafından kabul edilmiş bir kahraman olmak istiyor. Siz bu süreçte Wryn'ı kontrol ederek ona yardım ediyorsunuz ve hikâyede herhangi bir duygusallık olmasa da sonu beni her bitirişimde etkliler, biraz fazla duygusalım böyle konularda herhalde... 

[b]Oynanış[/b]
Oyunda sıkılmayalım diye yaklaşık on iki (?) tane silah bulunmakta, ben genellikle tabancalarla ve katanayla takıldım. Katanayla mermilere vurduğumuz zaman mermi bizim imlecimizin olduğu yöne doğru fırlıyor, çoğu zaman düşmanın bana yönelttiği mermileri geri teptirerek onları yendim ve oldukça iyi hissettirdiğini söylemem gerekiyor. Oyunda bazen gelen mermilerden kaçınmak imkansız olabiliyor, bu yüzden Matrixvari süper güçlerimizi kullanıyoruz! Evet, oyunda zamanı bir süreliğine yavaşlatabiliyoruz, cooldown'ı (tekrar dolma süresi) var tabii. Cooldown süresi karakterden karaktere göre değişebiliyor, oyunda toplamda dört karakter var ve her bir zorluğu bitirdiğinizde (en azından kolay hariç) yeni bir karakter açılıyor. Oyunlarda genellikle dash (belirlenen yöne doğru hızlıca hareket etme) olur bilirsiniz, bu oyunda da var fakat bu oyundaki dash'in daha özgür olduğunu söyleyebiliriz. Dash yaptığımız sürede karakterimizi istediğimiz şekilde yönlendirebiliyoruz, oynadığınız zaman anlarsınız. Açıkçası, her bölümün sonunda yaklaşık 2-3 tane boss çıkıyor, ilk biri veya ilk ikisi son çıkıcak boss'a göre daha kolay oluyorlar. Bu bosslar oyunu eğlenceli yapan en büyük tarafı. Şahsen White MK. II ile kapışırken oldukça eğleniyorum.

[b]İçerik[/b]
 Bleed, kendi karakterimizi güçlendirebilmek için bir markete sahip. Market üzerinden silah, daha fazla can, daha fazla enerji gibi materyaller alabiliyoruz. 

Ek olarak oyunun kolay, normal, zor ve çok zor zorlukları var. İlerleyen zorluklarda ilk başlarda zorlansanız da bir süre sonra alışıyorsunuz. 

Ayrıca, oyunun tekrar oynanabilirliği artsın diye oyuna bir rank sistemi eklenmiş. Bir bossla kapışırken kapıştığınız bossu sonunda doğru bir süre boyunca eğer hasar almadan yenebilirseniz bossu "S" rankında yenmiş oluyorsunuz ve her bir bossu ilk S rankında öldürüşünüzde size bir başarım geliyor. 

[list]
[*][h1][b]Artıları[/b][/h1]
+ Çeviklik ve beceri isteyen bir oynanış
+ Her bölümün sonunda en az bir mini-boss ve bir boss bulunması.
+ Silah çeşitliliği ve markete sahip olması
+ Zamanı duraklatabilme özelliği
+ Özgürce dash yapabilme
+ Tekrarlanabilirliğe sahip olması

[*][h1][b]Eksileri[/b][/h1]
- Düşük grafikler
- Kısa sürmesi
[/list]

[h1][b]NOT:[/b][/h1] Yukarıda "Bir kahraman olmak istiyorum" yazıyor.

32918696.review:
It's kind of weird for me to review this game. I'll start with the cons. My major "complaint" is how hard it was for me to get used to the mechanics, three dash-jumps from start + slowmo was a lot to get used to, and if you're like me and decide to start the game on hard you're probably not gonna have a great time on the first level... And that first level is 1/7 of the game, which takes me to the next point: the game is really short, like, 40 minutes short, it ends when you're finally getting the hang of the controls.  
Now, the reason I find hard to review this is cause those cons are also pros. The game is short, but no two parts are the same and every section in every level is filled up with new content and mechanics. The controls feel weird at first but HOLY SHIT it's awesome to use the slow-mo to dodge two bullets, change weapon in mid air to hit that third one with the katana, make a few wall jumps get height and dash above those enemies, change to rocket launcher again without even touching the ground once and... You get it, it's fun. 
To me, what makes the game is its replayability, and I'm sad cause I know not many people are into that. Each level has 4 difficulties with actual variations in them (different boss patterns, enemy placement, etc), and if you think finishing a level is fun, try finishing a level on v. hard without dying. It feels so rewarding when you know the layout and just how to use your abilities properly.  
This review is already a mess and I haven't mentioned most of the stuff, so: graphics look cool, music is fine, story is almost non existent (still charming and the two dialogues are... good, I guess?) and everything feels made up with so much love. When you die, for example, Wryn says different stuff in different stages, that alone shows you how much attention they put into this little game.  
Currently I have just a few hours, but I *WILL* finish everything on v. hard.
TL;DR: the game gets its awesomeness from replaying and learning the stages, so if that's not your thing, it's probably just gonna have twenty minutes of gameplay.

30784710.review:
After playing, and before reviewing, I wondered what could cause people to not recommend this game.  Looks like most said it was too short. I think the length is appropriate.  It is intended to be beatable in a single sitting (though it is not required) It is probably about as long as the games it is intended to resemble. 
I have yet to play the coop mode, but i do like that it is available.
One reviewer complained about the twin-stick controls on the platformer being bad.  I did find it a bit easier to use WSAD and the mouse, despite twin-stick shooting in a platformer being a factor originally drawing me to the game.  Either way it is fun and well done.
Graphics are retro in a good way.  The pixelation is definitely done to cater to the style, not to cater to laziness; the art is well detailed. For me the biggest downfall would be the title is a bit similar to another indie platformer. The plot is a bit contrived, but amusing and sufficient.  Maybe you require more "reason" to go around committing wonton acts of violence, but I feel this game is more about gameplay rather than the game's story, and it got gameplay right. It certainly was more fun that you just had reading my review.
If you are considering the cost, I prefer quality over quantity.  It isn't very expensive, and is certainly long enough. But if you must be cheap--i totally get it. i also want to buy more games that i wont play--click that wishlist button and wait for the next steam sale, but once you get it you'll be sorry you waited so long.  With probably a hundred never played games, i've beaten this one more than once.

30605481.review:
Not a perfect game in any sense but a very damn good one, especially for the cost of entry. Best suited for a rainy day when you need a game that won't steal weeks of your life away, but can occupy you for an afternoon or two.

Pro's:
+ Engaging gameplay with fun air dash mechanics and tight controls
+ Good replayability due to unlockables and achievements
+ Pleasant and catchy soundtrack
+ Diversity in levels
+ Short lived enough that it doesn't steal away your social life for weeks on end like many AAA titles.

Con's
- Can be tough as nails. Still died a crap ton on Normal difficulty on my first playthrough. This is offset by multiple difficulty settings including an easy setting so feel free to take that into account.
- Can be difficult to figure out what you are doing at first. I didn't even know I had a bullet time esque ability until the end of the second level. 

Notes:
~ Short lived, but as I stated previously makes the game better suited to occupy an afternoon or two on a rainy day.

30046278.review:
Extrêmement nerveux et exigeant, Bleed est un jeu de plateforme qui, une fois les contrôles assez singuliers maîtrisés, offrira une expérience de jeu intense et satisfaisante. Malgré mes maigres 3h de played, j'ai beaucoup apprécié ce titre. 

Esthétiquement, il fait très rétro et l'OST accompagne bien cette ambiance. Il serait exagéré de dire que le style est très inspiré, mais il fait vraiment mouche on pourrait presque croire que Bleed arrive directement d'une cartouche Mega Drive, à ce titre. :D 

Le gameplay est très rapide, et la gestion des deux sticks (un pour le mouvement, un pour le tir) avec un triple saut et un bullet time rendent le tout très gratifiant : quand on fonce à l'arrache, on en paye le prix, mais sitôt qu'on gère bien ces outils, ça paye et on le sent immédiatement.

Le jeu a potentiellement une excellente durée de vie avec différent niveaux de difficulté (je n'ai fait que le normal et quelques hards) ainsi que des modes de jeux supplémentaires. 

Petit point négatif : le jeu propose un choix varié d'armes, mais au final j'en revenais très souvent au duo pistolets / lance-flammes. Peut-être n'ai-je pas poussé assez les modes difficiles mais il m'a semblé que beaucoup d'arms étaient là pour la déco. 

Je recommande fortement.

29998530.review:
There are a lot of reviews with similar reviews to the following:

First Playthrough:
Awesome, totally loving this!

Second Playthrough:
Wow! That was a Challenge!

Five seconds into Second Playthrough:
I really hate this game!


These reviews are quite accurate to my own experience, and because of that, I cannot suggest this game. I bought it for very very cheap and it still did not feel like it was worth it. The controls are awful, the difficulty curve is almost random, and the higher difficulties just give enemies too many advantages to be anything but masochist-ware.

Do not think I am being a fool about this or being dramatic either. Seriously look at the time played by many of the thumbs up reviewers. Sure, a few have played 10+ hours, but most have played less than me. Just a couple of minutes ago, I checked to see the top positive review on the page had 0.1 hours of play time. How can someone give an honest and proper review of a game after only playing about 6 minutes?! It might even be a fake review for all I know!

Edit 3/6/2017:
I was over-exagerrating the frustration of this game. In all actuality, it's just the Worm boss on higher difficulties and almost every non-story play mode that is terrible, but yes, this game is still so very, very flawed.

Edit 7/6/2017:
I recently came to an understanding of my frustration with this game, and why I still return to play it despite it being a terribly painful game to play. When you look at this game, it is basically a crappy version of Cave Story, but with a poorly made mechanic to slow down time.

The weapon types, the boosting, and the platforming combat; they are all like Cave Story, but Cave Story is far superior in every way, has a comprehensible story, and is not crap despite being very difficult. I would recommend buying Cave Story+ on Steam over Bleed, even though Cave Story+ is three times the price and Bleed has better percentage reductions during sales. That's just how much I hate this game in comparison to a well made masterpiece.

29899834.review:
Bleed is a very short, but very well made game. It's a fast-paced 2D platformer/shooter with a large focus on boss battles.

The controls are precise, fluid and simple with the choice between keyboard controls and gamepad controllers (the XBOX 360 controller apparantly has official support, but I only used keyboard controls myself).

The difficulty is challenging but fair, although I've only played on the normal difficulty so far so I can't comment on the higher levels. I died a few times, but it wasn't frustrating because checkpoints are very frequent and I could get back to the game pretty quickly. Everytime I redid a section or boss I did better as I got better and learnt their moves. Every victory felt earned rather than just handed to me.

The story is barely there, you play as Wryn (I think that's how to spell it) who is disgusted by the heros of old, who have grown complacent and corrupt over time. She decides she will kill them and show everyone what a real hero is meant to be. It's a bare-bones plot, but it provides some context for the game I guess. It doesn't intrude on the gameplay and you can skip it without missing much.

The games art is something I can easily see people dismissing it over. Wryn herself looks like something from a young teenager's deviantart. It's simple and stylised and maybe not in a good way. Personally I don't mind it and the game is so quick-paced that I'm never focusing too much on any thing except bosses which tend to be the nicest looking things in the game.

As I said in the beginning, the game is very short. How short? I beat the story in an hour on the normal difficulty. While it might be short, the game uses this well as it's packed full of action and is never slow or boring. It's a quick, fun experience you can keep coming back to or replay over and over trying to get a better time or score.

I would very much reccommend this game, if you're still on the fence wait for it to go on sale. It's pretty cheap and if you like it enough, the sequel is out now as well!

29763202.review:
(este analisis originalmente lo hice en febrero, pero como no me gustaba como quedó hice este, y dejo aca un mensaje despues de haber terminado el análisis) BUENO! Espero que este análisis te ayude en si vas a comprarte el juego o no (compralo) y que abajo del todo dejo un resumen que sirve como conclusion del análisis completo (en serio COMPRALO YA!!!)


Bleed! Que significa.... umm... ¿sangró? ¿sangrado? DA IGUAL! (resultó que significa sangrar, gracias traductor de google :D)
Lo que sí importa es que este es un juego (vaya, no me digas) de acción rápida y divertida con un estilo muy a lo arcade y con un poco de plataformeo.

Voy a mencionar las cosas que me parecen más importantes de este juego, que son:

CONTROLES - BOSSES - NIVELES - REJUGABILIDAD

CONTROLES: Bleed como supone ser un juego de acción RÁPIDA tiene unos controles excelentes. 
Tienes un salto comun (como en cualquier juego de plataformas) y cuando estas en el aire puedes hacer 3 dashes con los que puedes maniobrar perfectamente a donde quieres ir y que combina perfectamente con la habilidad para RALENTIZAR EL TIEMPO, la cual es increiblemente util y divertido usarla con los BOSSES (pero de eso toca hablar despues). Está buenisimo el esquivar en el aire todas las balas cual ninja en cámara lenta. 

BOSSES: Increible!! Aunque el juego mas o menos dura entre 1 hora y hora y media, hay MUCHOS bosses, buenisimos y variados, desde pelear en un edificio contra un helicoptero hasta pelear contra un robot mantis gigante en un tren en movimiento. Y no solo eso, tambien le dan muy buen uso a la habilidad para RALENTIZAR EL P*TO TIEMPO hay ataques que solo los puedes... este... LITERALMENTE VER solo con esa habilidad y otro boss que es super rápido si usas la habilidad para RALENTIZAR EL PINCHE TIEMPO lo puedes ver y el boss aparece ahí mirandote y tu intentando esquivar las balas mientras le disparas y... A QUE ESTÁ BUENO EL JUEGO???

NIVELES: Muy buenos! Aunque no sean la gran cosa, cada nivel te bombardea con nuevas mecanicas para que NO dejes de jugar hasta terminar el juego. (como esta parte del análisis quedó muy corta voy a alargarla un poco más poniendo este paréntesis de relleno :D)

REJUGABILIDAD: Este juego al ser muy corto se basa en... pues la palabra lo dice todo, jugarlo una y otra vez.
Hay 4 dificultades (Facil-Normal-Dificil-Muy Dificil) y dependiendo de cual elijas abran MÁS o MENOS enemigos y serán MÁS o MENOS agresivos. En vez de como en otros juegos, que los enemigos simplemente hagan más daño y ya. Y los jefes en dificil son BUE-NI-SI-MOS!!

Aunque si, el juego tiene algunos errores como por ejemplo el tener que comprar mejoras y armas, lo cual te obliga a empezar en dificultades menores y farmear un poco si necesitas un arma especifica (como la katana ninja!!!) para matar a un boss en dificultad dificil o muy dificil aunque seas un PROASO COMO YO!! 

RESUMEN: Si estás buscando un juego de acción pura y dura, que ponga a prueba tu habilidad y reflejos, al cual jugar una y otra y OTRA y OTRA VEZ!!! sin importarte el que terminarlo la primera vez solo dure poco más de 1 hora RECOMENDADISIMO!!! 

PD: Tambien hay un Bleed 2 juegalo tambien :D
AH! y por cierto dame pulgar arriba que cuesta menos tiempo que pasarte este juego :D

29452318.review:
Fun "Run & Gun" game! Good anti-frustrating features such as: checkpoints at each screen transition, weapon-swap at the pause menu, and slowing down time to aim better & dodge at the last second! The Main Character, Wryn, even encourages you on the game over screen! 

Good variety of weapons to use, but you have to unlock them. You can move around, jump, air-dash a total of 3 times between landing, wall jump, and slow down time! This gives you TONS of mobility; you can jump around killing every enemy on the screen, or just avoid them all and go right for the bosses. Good for casual play and hardcore mastery alike.

Fast-paced, enjoyable experience overall, good job Bootdisk Revolution!

29451867.review:
I want to love this game and there is so much potential, but the overall control scheme and the game's design are in a constant battle.

On a 360 pad, movement is pretty great and fluid.  Button placement for default is spot on, there aren't any times when a single finger needs to press two buttons at the same time.  However, the game needs somewhat precise aiming, more than the right stick on a 360 pad can really offer.

So then there's kb/m controls which are similar to Hotline: Miami in that your character shoots at your cursor, regardless of screen position.  This solves the aiming problem that the 360 pad has, but then introduces fun new problems with character movement between jumping, wall jumping, and dashing that just doesn't mesh with kb/m.

If there were some way to take the fluid movement of the left stick of a 360 pad and combine it with the precision aiming of a mouse, this game would be amazing, but as it currently stands it is confused as to what it wants to be.

29332304.review: I absolutely adore Bleed.  The game places you in control of an overpowered-feeling character who genuinely seems to have sprung out of the mind of a child who dreams of being an action hero.  She dual wields rapid fire guns (among other weapon options), can execute several jumps before hitting the ground, and can slow down time.  The controls are quite tight and once you get used to jumping with the trigger button it feels very natural.  You would think with all that power the game would be too easy, but the levels are equally overpowered.  It manages to be a genuinely hard game while making you feel like you can accomplish anything.  I especially like the ability to play two player co-op as it is a fun game to show off to a friend, though it suffers from the same issues that all same-screen co-op games have with regard to accidentally harming your friend by going at the wrong pace or them doing so to you.  I am on the fence about the choice to have the characters share the health bar--when it goes right it encourages more cooperativity but when it goes wrong you both die.  Would recommend to anyone who likes twin stick shooters and has taste.

29289470.review:
Great game. It's short but has lots of replay value with multiple difficulty modes, game modes, characters and weapons for you to try out and a high skill ceiling for anyone looking to dive deeper. Longer games may be better value for money but this game gives about as good a value for time invested as is possible.

29145212.review:
在双摇杆手柄出现后，主机上的仰视角射击终于可以实现全方面，无死角的攻击操作了。这类游戏最常见的场面，大概就是主角边用太空步后退，边射击身后追着的一堆敌人了。Bleed这款游戏将会以传统的横版卷轴射击，配合现代的开发技术实现过去不太可能见到的玩法，将复古的游戏类型灌入了新的理念。

 
欧美尤其喜欢这种类型，但是多数都逃不出“二人转”的死板玩法
玩家只要推动右摇杆方向，便可对指定方向射击，而为了保持边跑边打，游戏的其它操作都把按键放到了扳机键上。游戏中跳跃与冲刺都被设置在RT上，与射击一样，配合移动可以对任意方向高速移动。
无论是进行多么剧烈的回避，主角的射击动作都不会被打断，而关卡中敌人的出现与攻击设计，都是构筑在“任何角度都可能出现”的前提下，为了配合这种激烈的节奏，玩家可以消耗能量随时发动“子弹时间”。在这个状态下，一些平时难以回避的高速攻击都可以依靠刁钻的角度回避掉。
每个关卡的小阶段都可以无限续关，关卡通过后玩家也可以反复进入，挑战更高难度与成就。如果能保持无伤地持续连击，便可以提升分数倍率，而没一个BOSS也都有着要求在S评价下击破的成就。

 
本作将视角换成了横向卷轴，在还原前者的玩法上，强化了对地形的利用与动作元素
本作的核心玩法，便是建立在以上三种十分基础的动作设计上。它们与关卡设计相辅相成，用十分简单的系统换来了流畅而专一的游戏体验。游戏开发者对自己有着很明确的定位，将流程的设计与系统的思路结合后，这种概念简单却又不失个性的理念被发挥得十分完美。

这个时代，对Bleed这样的独立游戏是十分友好的。他们即可以保留着老游戏的风貌，又拥有早年开发者的梦寐以求的优异环境，可以靠着技术的进步实现以前新颖的玩法。游戏十分便宜，不了解进包与否。续作已经上线Steam页面，预计明年将会正式发售，感兴趣的可以关注一下。

 在通关后的BOSS战模式中，玩家可以随意配置复数的BOSS同时出场。而一命通关的街机模式也极富挑战性。  

赞：

在传统与新颖的风格间达到的良好平衡
多种攻略模式与随意搭配的BOSS对战
满足各阶段水平玩家的难度与挑战配置
烂：

可能不是很令人满意的画面与人设
武器设计不太平衡，双枪使用频繁

29133557.review:
I picked this up after selling a few extra cards I had laying around.  Wasn't quite sure what to expect, but it is really an A rating for the gameplay and polish.  You feel like a badass.  It's not overly difficult, and even less so because it has very generous and painless checkpoints, so you do have some punishment, but not much.  You can play the insanely difficult 1 life for the enitre game mode if you want, but I think you have to beat the game first.  You almost certainly want to use a game controller to play this.  I'd guess it's frustrating without one.

The downside, it's got no voice acting if you really care, but the main thing is that it's short.  Really short.  Really, really short.  I beat the game and played a few challenges in 2 hours.  For the full price, it's really only worth it if you're the type who likes to play a good mechanic repeatedly on a few bosses and characters to become perfect.  If you're diving through for story and/or content to play and repeating bores you, then still get this game, but wait for a sale.  Absolutely a recommendation.  I'm looking forward to seeing what the sequal looks like.

28576211.review:
I never review games, but I needed to this time. This game is one of those games that make you feel good because of it's energy rather than it's content. Confusing, I know. Wryn is one of my favorite protagonists of all time just based on the hour and half I spent with her. She's funny, self referential and feels more like a person than games with 10,000 times the budget.

It sounds like I'm blowing smoke, and I might be in the minority, but I'm buying Bleed 2 based solely on her character. As far as gameplay go, it's a fun platformer and is deceptively difficult. It wasn't easy even on Normal, but if you continue on, you'll make it through. Luckily the check point system is very fair and the Bullet Time makes up for your skill even if you're bad.

Have fun with this game, it has plenty of charm, and I want a Wryn shirt (I'm looking at you Ian Campbell!).

28170899.review:
This game is something different than I though it will be but it's not a bad thing. I'm not sure if Bleed can be even called a platform game - there is just way too much fast-paced action. And like I said - it's not a bad thing. It's fun, but way too short. If someone is planning to play it only once it won't even take 1 hour. It's fun to replay all the time, unlock everything there is to be unlocked and beat your scores. I love the art of this game, music is very catchy and Wryn is lovely as hero. Yet, there is some stuff that is lacking and could be better - co-op. Why there is on multiplayer option? It could make Bleed even more popular, but I don't think it's some kind of unknown indie game. While we have option to play together on one PC, it's still lacking - no times, no scores to compare with others while playing together. I don't know if it would be easy to pull ot not but for a game this fun to play with someone, it's really too bad.

I'm glad to hear that there is Bleed 2 coming out, I will be sure to get it for reasonable price. If you love fast action games and don't mind 2D, then Bleed is a must play for you. It's one of indie games that is worth to play for sure.

I have not played past the second level but I wanted to post some quick notes that might be helpful.

-First of all, for the sale price this is absolutely fantastic, and for full price it’s probably worthwhile too.

-Works great on Mac, and with the PS3 controller over Bluetooth.

-I find the controls to be very tricky because I keep wanting to use traditional SNES jumping mechanics which do not apply here: In Bleed, you jump with a trigger button instead of a face button, and you aim your jumps with 360º precision. I keep holding “left” when pressing the jump button, intending to go “up and left” – as it would work in a traditional platformer. But, in this case, holding “left” while jumping moves the character directly to the left, and right into the wall.

-Overall I find the game to be very difficult on Easy mode. In level 2 there is a sequence that requires jumping through falling debris that I find very challenging. This game (at least so far) appears to have no health pickups, although there are ample checkpoints.

This creator is working hard on creating great games... support him!

27896133.review:
A fun action platforming shooter game where you make use of air-dashing and time-slowing mechanics to dodge enemy attacks and move around the levels.  While the levels themselves are pretty short (you can complete each level in a few minutes), they are well designed, and the different difficulties increases the replayability.  As you play on higher difficulties, enemy attacks and stage hazards change in ways that significantly change gameplay.

Since the story can be finished pretty quickly, the game strongly encourages replaying the stages on higher difficulties to unlock characters and weapons (although for the most part you'll likely stick with the default dual pistols).  There are also achievements that encourage replaying stages, mainly ones for maintaining a high style rating, or for completing stage-specific objectives.  There is also an arcade mode which has you playing through the entire game on one life (without any healing) and a challenge mode where you can fight up to 3 bosses at once.

I personally recommend playing this with a controller.  Using a keyboard isn't too bad, but I prefer using the analog stick for more control when air-dashing.

[h1] Whew, it's been quite a while since i played one of these [/h1]

[b] Bleed is a fast-paced, retro-ambiented, cool-in-many-ways, difficult and fair dual-stick shooter.[/b]

It's really got a lot of stuff going for it, so i'll just put in the cons:

*Smol game, smol price.
*Not really a fan of the artwork but hey, it's not trash.
*Main story mode is really shorty but you can replay alt gamemodes

And here are the pro's:

*Fun
*Challenging
*Intuitive, cool, early-generations' mechanics.
*Cool game in its entirety
*Decent OST
*Weapon choices
*Fast-Paced
*Cheap, and replayable (You can take a lot out of your money if you play this a lot)
*Characters aren't annoying
*Comedic, using relatable >gamer jokes (but no cringe tho)
*Forgiving, but rewarding as well.
*No design flaws, in a broad way.
*Hype-inducing Bullet Hell 2hu gameplay.

25714665.review:
Bleed is a medium-paced platformer with gameplay reminiscent of Contra and Metroid, but the twin stick controls lack the precision that would make this game fun to play. 

I played through the game with a Logitech F310 gamepad. The trigger jump took some getting used to, but I could never get precision aiming for any of the weapons I tried. Going through the game at a fast pace on easy mode is doable, but attempting the game at higher levels of difficultly would require greater finesse of controls than the game provides. I also tried using a Steam controller, but this only made the game less playable than with the F310.

The graphics are well-done, and a few of the bosses provide a unique challenge compared to other games in the genre. The game is fairly short, although it provides a few additional modes and features to be unlocked.

I really wanted to like this game, but imprecise controls are a deal breaker.

25492579.review:
Маленькая короткая игра, которая меня сильно зацепила. А чем? Хм… ну тут по порядку: 
Геймплей: Просто продвигайся от уровня к уровню, попутно отстреливая всякую нечисть. На каждом уровне есть мини босс и непосредственно основной. На высоких уровнях противники намного сильнее, и это заключается не только из-за их количества. Они атакуют намного активнее и больнее, изворачиваться надо всё больше. Доходит вплоть до того, что увернуться просто невозможно (катана, бери её! Рикошеты пуль – имба!). За выполнения задания начисляются очки, которые можно потратить на оружие и усиления протагониста. Всё довольно просто
Саундрек: Да я просто обожаю chiptune! Музыка вполне хорошая, слушать не надоедает ( композицию с негромким названием «Wryn’s theme» я никак не могу наслушаться :3). Кстати, весь саундпак распространяется бесплатно… Гугл в помощь
К сожалению, среди этих плюсов закрадывается один очень большой минус – игра неимоверно, просто критично короткая. Не сразу поняв механику и проигрывая довольно часто, я прошел её буквально часа за полтора – это очень мало, благо у неё относительно хорошая реиграбельность , но это не отменяет того факта, что если не перепроходить, то она пройдётся быстро. Может это и плюс – тот короткий момент она игралась на одном дыхании (со смертями, ага)
Однозначно рекомендую для ознакомления: цена не кусается, а со скидками так вообще копейки. Вперёд, становиться героем!

25230711.review:
I just learned that this game was on Steam last night, and I don't think I've ever hit 'buy' faster in my entire life. I've had the demo for several years, and I absolutely loved it, but I was completely unaware that the full game was available(in all honesty that may just be because the demo only offered so much, and I eventually forgot about it).

PROS
-The controls are solid, though you may have better luck with a gamepad than a keyboard. Wryn's moveset, as basic as it is, offers a lot of maneuverability once you practice enough. The gun(s) are delightfully diverse between each, and since you can carry two at once, you won't need to switch very often. If you do need to switch, however, the devs threw in a 'Change Weapon' option in the pause menu.
-The soundtrack, while not the best I've ever heard, is still absolutely wonderful, and I can't help but get pumped up whenever I hear it.
-The enemy designs are just delightful, and fit each stage well.
-The level design is equally as good, requiring skill, but still being forgiving enough to let you fix your mistakes.
-The bosses are ridiculously fun, diverse in design, and challenge the player every single second of the fight.

CONS
-The art. While I'm a sucker for old-school pixel games, this one looks like it was made with MS Paint. I personally don't mind it too much, but it definitely slips into uncanny at points.

BEFORE YOU BUY
-It's difficult, to the point where even Normal is enough to kill you in a matter of minutes. This game requires practice, practice, practice. Expect to die a lot.
-This may just be me being awful at the game, but stages do not give you many points unless you explicitly choose to play them on Hard or Very Hard. In most cases this wouldn't be a problem, and it would make sense, but considering the previous point...yeah, it gets kind of brutal and grindy, especially if you want to max out your upgrades/purchase all of the weapons. (Spoiler warning: You want to max out your upgrades for the later stages, because they are BRUTAL)
-This game is SHORT. I beat it on Normal in about 3 hours. That's not a bad thing, per se, but it's definitely something you should keep in mind.
-Not for people who dislike bullet hells.

FINAL SCORE: 8.5/10

25048123.review:
[i]Вспомнил об игре в преддверии второй части, анонсированной 10 августа[/i]

Недурный платформерный шутер с механикой замедления времени, позволяющей натурально чувствовать себя Нео, пока не исчерпается шкала концентрации. Можно поэкспериментировать с покупаемым оружием, некоторые образцы неслабо меняют геймплей.

Сюжет прост как две копейки: в мире побеждены все негодяи, герои обласканы славой, остальным желающим проявить себя нечем. Поэтому девчуля, за которую игроку предстоит отдуваться, решает поступить радикально - вырезать всех героев и на общем фоне уже выглядеть значимо. Проходим уровни с кучей врагов, добираемся до босса, подбираем тактику его изничтожения и переходим к следующему.

Сама игра не очень долгая, но предлагает развлечения и после кампании. Попробовать уничтожить всех боссов подряд, например, или пройти все уровни без восстановления здоровья между этапами. Открыть новых персонажей и ачивки.

24502415.review:
Bleed to gra platformowa z dawką akcji, w której naszym zadaniem jest pomóc naszej bohaterce stać się najlepszym herosem po tej stronie galaktyki, na przeszkodzie stają nam wszelakie przeszkody, różnorodni przeciwnicy oraz potężni bossowie, w pokonaniu tego wszystkiego pomoże nam dosyć ciekawy arsenał broni oraz Bullet Time, który pozwala spowolnić czas i nie raz uratuje nam tyłek. Mamy w sumie 7 poziomów, które zawsze kończą się jakimś gigantycznym lub szybkim bossem wymagającym od nas refleksu i są całkiem ciekawie zrobione, a sam poziom trudności jest w miarę zbalansowany, mamy w sumie do wyboru 4 poziomy trudności od Easy do Very Hard, ja przeszedłem gre na Normal-u, ale gra jest wymagająca, każdego bossa trzeba załatwić w inny sposób (czyt. inną bronią) oraz trzeba szybko orientować się w atakach, bo życia dużo nie mamy, chyba że ulepszało się hp na maksimum.
 Choć gra długa nie jest to poza trybem fabularnym mamy jeszcze do wyboru tryb Arcade, w którym przechodzimy grę na jednym życiu i jeszcze możemy wybrać ilość hp z którą chcemy zacząć oraz mamy jeszcze tryb Challenge, w którym możemy wybrać dowolnych trzech bossów oraz w przypadku obu trybów poziom trudności, więc jak ukończymy fabułe to na nude tutaj nieucierpimy, a i tryb Arcade odblokowuje się po ukończeniu fabuły.

Przechodząc teraz do oprawy audiowizualnej. Grafika została utrzymana w pixelart-owym stylu, co nie znaczy, że jest zła, ale kto by się zachwycał pikselami. Mamy jeszcze muzykę, która jest ok i tyle.

Teraz mogę powiedzieć trochę o aspektach technicznych. Gra działa płynnie i nie trafił mi się błąd czy glitch, a sterowanie zostało dobrze wykonane, bardzo dobrze zostało zrobione według mnie sterowanie pod pada, gdzie jednocześnie celuje i strzelam bronią w miejsce ruchu prawego analogu, skok pod prawy spust, a bullet time pod lewy spust, trzeba się trochę przyzwyczaić, ale dalej jest już z górki.

Plusy i minusy:

Plusy:
+Ciekawa fabuła
+Napakowany akcją i bullet timem gameplay
+Motyw sklepu z ulepszeniami i lepszymi broniami za punkty zdobywane w trakcie gry
+Zbalansowany poziom trudności
+Ciekawy arsenał
+Różnorodni przeciwnicy
+Wymagający bossowie
+Dobrze zoptymalizowana gra
+Wiele trybów

Minusy:

24443036.review:
[h1]TL;DR:[/h1][b]Fun/challenging with a neat game mechanic.  Buy on sale, play once and forget it.[/b]

This game is good but despite what others say there really isn't much game here to begin with, never mind the supposed replay-ability many reviewers are talking about.

I beat the game on Normal Difficulty in < 1 hour, and that's about all I desire to play here.  I tried Hard Difficulty for my 2nd play-through, but there just wasn't enough variety of ANYTHING to keep me interested.

[h1]Likes[/h1]
[list]
[*] Female protagonist
[*] Funny, tongue-in-cheek story
[*] Creative graphics
[*] Good sound
[*] Good music
[*] Good game mechanic (time slowdown)
[*] Cool boss fights
[/list]

[h1]Dislikes[/h1]
[list]
[*] Grew bored even before reaching final level
[*] Very bare-bones enemy behavior
[*] Very bare-bones platforming
[*] Bland level/monster-placement
[*] No secrets, no exploration, totally linear
[/list]

Buy this on sale - the full asking price is outrageous for the limited play time the average player will get out of this.

The play time shown for me is not reflective of my actual in-game play.  Had to idle for a couple extra hours to get my Steam Trading Cards, which as an unexpected plus, are quite valuable relative to other games' cards.

24394594.review:
This type of game is definately not for everyone! As of this writing, I have finished the normal campaign and nothing else (so my knowledge is limited but the impressions are still fresh):
If you like the Mega Man (X) series AND twin-stick shooters, you will probably enjoy this one. There are some minor flaws here and there, but I'd say it's well-made overall. 

Features:
-Quite a lot of minibosses and bosses with several interesting patterns
-4 playable characters (only 1 at the beginning)
-bullet time (combined with up to 3 directional midair-dashes and wall jumps, this makes for some stylish moments / narrow escapes)
-several weapons that suit different situations/playstyles (including a melee weapon)
-rpg-ish permanent upgrades
-NO items are found throughout the levels, not even "medpacks", which might not be welcomed by everyone, but it allows you to focus more on the gameplay (at least you have infinite ammo for all weapons, bullet time recharges quickly too)
-frequent checkpoints upon death; death lowers money a bit (though you can replay levels as often as you want to "grind")
-4 difficulty levels
-additional game modes (e.g. boss gauntlets)
-simple but somehow likeable story
-retro/snes-feel
-secrets

Stay away if:
-You dislike possibly frustrating challenges that require you to fight the same boss several times until you figure out the patterns
-You want many hours of new content for your money
-You are not comfortable with tricky keyboard-movement while simultanously aiming with your mouse (haven't tried controller yet though)

24138638.review:
Bleed is a short but highly replayable and entertaining shooty gun game.

You play as a girl named Wryn who is the default hero and you must go through 7 stages to kill the heroes to prove you're the best hero in the land. You start with Dual Pistols and a Rocket Launcher for the early stages but you can acquire 10 more from the shop or by beating the game on a certain difficulty.

You can dash in the air up to 3 times which allows for rapid movement, positioning and general movement which makes getting through every stage a blast, you also have an action meter, which when used can activate bullet time to precisely land bullets or dodge and wave through theirs.

You have 4 difficulties to choose from (Easy, Medium, Hard and Very Hard) which all change enemy positions, boss attacks etc.

It took me around 70-80 minutes to complete the story campaign on Normal difficulty the first time, so don't expect a super long campaign.

There are 2 other variants on gameplay though besides characters, you can play challenge mode which lets you choose/ random from any 3 bosses in the game and fight them all at the same time for fun, or you can attempt to go through Arcade Mode, which is every stage back to back with no health refills or anything, it can get pretty damn hard when it wants to as well, especially in the later difficulties.

Soundtrack is pretty good too.

Although short, it's a fantastic game, if you're into Score Attacking or overcoming some pretty difficult challenges you'll probably get your money's worth there.
Also goes on sale real cheap sometimes so definitely pick it up then, you won't regret it!

23963789.review:
This game easily surpassed my expectations. I bought it expecting something simple only as a way to pass the time - fun but ultimately forgettable. It's way better than that.

I'm not exactly good at videogames, and there were times I thought I wouldn't handle the normal difficulty, so I changed it back to easy (eventually I managed beat the game in Normal as well). By doing that I realized the creator didn't only changed enemy hp, player hp or damage. The number of enemies, of attacks, it was all specifically tailored for each difficult. It's a level of effort many don't go through, and it's a great aspect of the game.

This aspect of the game is a part of one of the biggest qualities: the level design is excellent. There is a lot of variety in the ways you utilize the mechanics, the encounters are well planned and each level gives a distinct experience, with a smooth increase in difficulty.

The bosses are the greatest part for me, though. Each one is different and interesting, and finding the weapons that would work best and how to react to the patterns was a great experience. I died a lot, but it was far from frustating.

Bleed is really how a 2D plataformer should be done. It's on the short side, sure, but it's also very cheap. Every aspect of the game is well thought-out, even the silly story has a fun fake-out at the end that makes it less nonsensical. I'm eagerly awaiting for the next release of the developer.

Bardzo przyjemna gra, dla ludzi lubujących się w platformerach.

Po samym screenie, widać z grubsza co dostajemy. Mamy naszą postać, parę broni które możemy zmieniać w dowolnym momencie (aczkolwiek rzadko kiedy rezygnowałem z pistoletów, które dostajemy na początku) i większych i mniejszych przeciwników, których naprawdę przyjemnie się rozwala.

Siła gry tkwi w dobrym sterowaniu. Dostajemy nie tylko podwójny, ale i potrójny skok, którego będziemy zmuszeni używać nawet nie tyle do dostawania się w wysokie miejsca, co do uników.
Dostajemy też możliwość chwilowego spowalniania czasu, co sprawdza się tu zaskakująco dobrze, bo znacznie ułatwia lawirowanie wokół pocisków, które bez niego byłyby niezwykle trudne.
Jednocześnie nie trzeba ciągle na nim polegać.

Podobał mi się też lekki, wręcz humorystyczny klimat, aczkolwiek nie liczył bym na mocne żarty i komedię.

Jeżeli zaś chodzi o wady:
Gra jest dość krótka i pozostawia pewien niedosyt.
Przeszedłem ją dwa razy, na zwykłym i trudnym. Bawiłem się trochę w zaliczanie acziwmentów ale ostatecznie uznałem, że na razie nie chce mi się do niej wracać. Jednocześnie pokonanie ostatniego bossa, porównując do reszty gry, nie było jakoś szczególnie trudne.
Chciałbym trochę więcej.

Gra zostawia dodatkowe wyzwania, ale wolałbym żeby nie były jedynie kolejnymi utrudnieniami tego samego.

22902093.review:
Awesome game, very fun gameplay, totally worth it for its price (although I suppose it will be a little short).

Reminds me of the Megaman X series, except it's a twin-stick shooter. Could describe it as a 2D Devil May Cry, plus time slow-down powerup.

Insane difficulty, you will probably start it on normal then have to switch to easy at later levels (as early as the 3rd stage for me), finish the stage on easy, and then do it later on normal, with some more upgrades. Though it's nice that you can go back to previous stages in a higher difficulty (hard, very hard, and these will make you suffer) to farm a bit for some upgrades.

Also, on higher difficulties, some parts are almost bullet hell like, when they're throwing a crazy amount of bullets at you, and the only way you can possibly dodge is by slowing down time, but still, the curtains are very dense (for those who understand danmaku terms).

Even though I still haven't finished it, I definitely recommend it. I love the challenge, it's the kind of game that gets you actually talking to yourself as you play, and spontaneously swearing when you die. And finally, when you beat the boss, especially on higher dificulties, it's very rewarding. So you should definitely give it a try.

22857744.review:
Who needs a story when all you need in a game is ACTION ACTION ACTION!?

Highly recommend you start on easy. It's challenging enough to get used to the controls. Eventually get the hang of it. Don't be hesitant yet depend too much on the bullet-speed. Best used in situations that may seem impossible at normal speed, otherwise be wasted and have to wait out the cool-down once empty.

Heads up: A weapon requires a middle mouse button command, and it can't be rebinded (that command alone anyway).

Requires: Patient, Insanity, and the ability to not break keyboard keys.

Tip: Worry about the S-rank achievements after completing the story and maxing out on upgrades.

22585489.review:
シューティング2Dアクションゲーム
各ステージが短くてお手軽
キーボードでもコントローラーでも操作できる
全方位射撃出来る仕様で射撃方向をマウスで指定したほうが楽だったので僕はキーボードでプレイした

２つの武器を切り替えて戦うことが出来る
ステージ攻略時のスコアを貯めて武器やアップグレードを買うことになる
一度に持っていける武器は２つだけだが、いつでもメニューから切り替えられるので悩む必要はない
武器はロケットランチャーやビームライフルからKATANAまで用意されているものの、初期装備の二丁拳銃がかなり強力で、これで最後まで戦えた
KATANAは射程が短いものの、一部の銃弾を弾き返せるのと横に範囲が広くて二丁拳銃の欠点を補えるので重宝している

それからTIMEゲージを消費して時間をゆっくりにすることができる
時間をスローにするとプレイヤーも敵も行動が遅くなる
敵側はプレイヤーに比べて、より遅くなるので相対的に自分が早くなっている
並の反射神経ではかわしづらい速い攻撃も、このスロー能力を使えば簡単に回避できるので重要なアクションである
またエイムがやりやすくなったり、ちょっと操作が難しい空中三連ジャンプもやりやすくなる

二種類の武器の切り替え、スロー能力の他には横移動、ジャンプ、空中三連ジャンプくらいしかアクションが無いので非常に簡単で遊びやすい
１ステージにかかる時間も短くて、ストーリーをノーマルでクリアするのも３時間かからないと思う
慣れてきたらノーデスで全ステージ攻略するモードをやるといいかもしれない

短くて難しいゲーム

21835360.review:
Вам не во что играть? Вы не ломали клавиатуры и мониторы со времен выхода игр Super meat boy и Dark Souls? Добро пожаловать в Bleed!
Bleed- Это хардкорный платформер, в котором вам предстоит проходить уровни(Да ладно?). Тут нет особого сюжета, лишь тяжелые динамичные уровни с хорошим звуковым сопровождением.  Но тут присутсвует реиграбельность, т.к. нам предстоит пройти несколько раз уровни для получения денег и улучшения главной героини. Так же тут есть уровни сложности, но в отличие от обычных игр, сложность тут не влияет на здоровье мобов, их урон и т.п., а влияет на сложность уровня(Поведение мобов, их количество и дополнительные препятствия), что заставляет вас менять тактику прохождения.
Хоть эта игра является тяжелой, к ней быстро приспосабливаешься. 
В игре выделяется небольшое количество оружия, многие будудт лишь эффективны в некотрых условиях, и замедление времени, которое сильно вам поможет и придаст дополнительный адреналин во время прохождения. 
И по классике жанра, для особых игровых мазохистов, тут есть специальные испытания.

A nice simple shooter/easy platformer combo.

What's good:
*The timeslow/extra jump mechanic is lots of fun
*Controls are responsive/fair
*Fast paced/No tedious minigames
*Purposefully cheesy, simple story
*Moderate diversity in level design

What's not so good:
*Fairly short game
*Art is fun, but kinda mediocre
*Replay value runs out pretty quick

Overall, fun, a little light on content, but only $5. Also, I've read the 1 man developer is working on a signficantly improved Bleed 2, which is probably worth checking out eventually.

This game is both very approachable, and extremely challenging. It only has about 10 levels, but the variety of weapons, the complexity of the difficulty system (higher difficulty monsters actually behave differently, its not just a naive damage vs health based difficulty system), unlockable characters, and different game modes means that you could get weeks of play time out it.

Highly recommend it to anyone that likes fast paced technical shooting games.

20613837.review:
May be lacking in few aspects, but otherwise... a pleasant surprise.

Bleed reminds me about Noitu Love 2. Fact-paced action, 16-bit esthetic, high frequency of bosses per minute... It's all my cup of tea and I can happy report that pure gameplay is here really strong, worth checking out if you are someone who loves high-octane 2D platforming mayhem. Bullet-time mechanic is a catalyst that allows bosses to be seemingly more dangerous with their patterns and makes you feel like a total badass dodging bullets.

Game's goodness is unfortunately warped in not-so-stellar presentation and few other problems. What problems? Controls are great, but they require getting used to and gamepad is almost required to handle the challenge. Game also loves to kill you really fast if you don't know what to do. Fortunately, deaths don't feel cheap and checkpoints are plenty, You are never punished too much, but still better to get in good terms with Game Over screen.

Presentation and plot? Those are the lowest points of the game. Music unfortunately is really generic and not entertaining at all, barring some rare [i]fragments[/i] of tunes. Plot is completely off-the-rails stupid, even operating on cartoon logic... and don't let me start on how out-of-place are your enemies: "World Greatest Heroes" consisting of blob monster, pair of worms and alien morphing goo balls and few more... What? Simply, it doesn't make a lot of sense and you hardly can "tune-in" into world. Missed opportunity.

While game is also extremely short, it's replay value is high and amount of generated enjoyment is good enough for me to give a solid recommendation. Price is also nice, so you should probably keep Bleed in mind if you have some leftover funds.

20461075.review:
When I started using bullet time in addition to my guns, Bleed became much more enjoyable. The game moves too fast for you to run and gun like you can in other platformers of this sort. You have to employ bullet time in order to survive, even if you already possess lightning-fast reflexes. The gameplay was frustrating at first, especially with the combination of the right trigger to jump and the right stick to shoot, but after a little while the controls began to feel just right. Having the left trigger's bullet time compliment the right trigger's multi-jump was definitely a good move on the part of the developer.

In addition, there's reason to play the smallish number of levels over and over again when you earn points that can be spent on health and bullet time upgrades as well as new weapons. And the greater the difficulty setting, the greater the points you earn. So there's every reason to want to complete each stage on V. Hard. And the graphics and soundtrack are top notch, too.

So what are you waiting for? Go get yourself a copy... or borrow some playtime with Bleed from a friend's account. It's time and money worth spending.

Wirklich tolles, wenn auch recht kurzes Spiel. 
Wenn man sich erstmal durch die erste halbe Stunde gekämpft hat und die Steuerung inklusive Bullet-Time Mechanik verinnerlicht hat, macht es unglaublich Spaß! :) 

Mir persönlich gefällt der Grafikstil sehr, aber das ist wohl abhängig vom individuellen Geschmack. Den Sound fand ich im Gegensatz zu anderen Reviews hier nicht so besonders toll. Nervt nicht, aber ist auch nicht einprägsam und für mich sind sogar ein paar unangenehme Geräusche dabei.

Der wichtigste Punkt ist aber das Gameplay! Und obwohl es ein simpler Plattformer/Shooter-Hybrid ist, spielt es sich imo wirklich sehr frisch. Grade die Kombination mit der Bullet-Time habe ich als extrem spaßig empfunden. Man kommt sich einfach unglaublich cool vor, wenn man in Zeitlupe durch den gegnerischen Kugelhagel fliegt und dabei gleichzeitig den Gegner mit seiner Waffe bearbeitet.

Nachdem ich das Spiel jetzt auf Normal durchgespielt habe (und EINIGE Male gestorben bin), versuche ich mich jetzt definitiv noch an den anderen Schwierigkeitsgraden und Modi. Weitere Waffen /Charaktere gibt es auch zum Freischalten.

20000269.review:
Let's start off by saying that I would recommend you try this game. It's fun, intense and is just generally a great game. But by no means is it perfect.

My biggest issue with the game is the length. It is literally 6 levels [spoiler]technically 7 but the last level is just a combination of the first 6[/spoiler] and they are all very short. They can probably be completed in about 10 minutes on your first try, on easy mode, if you aren't used to this sort of game. But once you have finished them, there are a bunch of upgrades to unlock. However, you can only unlock them by replaying the levels over and over. The different difficulties don't  change the way the enemies behave so not even that will increase the replayability. So that is the biggest issue with the game, and it can put a lot of people off if a game is too short.

The second issue I have with the game is that the controls are weird. On controller, it's very difficult to aim since it's a twin stick shooter platformer but on keyboard it is more difficult to actually aim in all directions at once, and you will need to aim in all directions at once with the amount of enemies that spawn. The triple jump mechanic is interesting and if you pull off cool dodges with it then it feels satisfying but it does have its downsides that make it a little unresponsive sometimes.

The story is pretty lame so don't come to this game for a story and the artstyle is typical pixel art and doesn't detract from the game for me but it doesn't do anything special. The same goes for the music in the game.

Those were my main issues with the game. If you can get past those then you should try this game. It is really fun and intense. The harder difficulties can provide a great challenge and the bosses are also all very unique and some of them are quite challenging when you start the game.

19928227.review:
Excellent old-school action game, with charming pixel-art and and some neat ideas put together. The action on screen is intense - especially on harder levels - while the bullet-time mechanics and mid-jump dashes make up for varied and interesting fights. The stage design is pretty good and each and every boss fight demanded different strategies.

It may be a bit short, but on the other hand it doesn't get repetitive. 

Also, chasing for Steam achievements on Bleed added some interesting challenges. I played a fair share of action platformers back in the day, and Bleed certainly deserves a mention among those old games I like so much.

8/10, would totally help Wryn be the best hero of all time again.

If you're worried about difficulty, don't, for two reasons: a) normal difficulty is fine and b) even if there is a hard part (which there are), the game is so much fun and so well designed that it's still a lot of fun to play. 19864706.review:
Bleed is like a rollercoaster, for all you adrenaline junkies out there. For those that prefer something calmer, Bleed is like reading an amazing book when the sequel is just around the corner, and you had no idea it existed.

Bleed's an arcade-y action platformer that never seems to stop with the punches it pulls: it's main mechanic, being able to slow down time, does so much for the game: things that seem incredibly difficult to dodge in real time are made far easier, making Bleed something akin to almost a bullet hell (minus the tiny hitbox; but if you're hit, it's generally your fault due to some pretty lenient hitboxes). It's fast, relentless...much like you will be: fast and relentless against the heroes that dare stand in your way in your pursuit of being number one.

For only 99 cents, this game is an ABSOLUTE MUST for those into action games. Great replayability, great speedrun-ability, great game altogether. Comes highly recommended.

19864677.review:
Bleed, the fast paced shoot em up! And is it good? Well, yeah! Just read this review to find out exactly why!

This game is good, there's no denying it. And I'm not just gonna sit here and say "yeah the game's good, get it". Because that would be scummy of me. I'm going to start with the basics of the game and then move on to talk about the art and controls. Each will have quite a bit to talk about, so be prepared for that.

So, as for the basics of this game, Bleed is a fast-paced, frantic platformer. As you run around the levels you will encounter many beasts and ghouls, all of which unique to the level. When I say unique, I mean that each enemy is never really shown again in the same level. To put it simply, the sprites are never lazily thrown around as if the game doesn't matter, it's obvious that the devs of this game have put a lot of thought and effort into the actual design of the levels and the enemies, which pays off in the end.

In terms of gameplay it's, as I've said before, fast-paced and frantic. This is further enforced by the side-scrolling element which is tossed in. You advance in each level by either scaling upwards or downwards and running from place to place. As to be expected in a side-scroller, I suppose. Whilst also talking about gameplay, I think I should talk about the biggest mechanic in the game. Time slowing. How it works is, you hold down your RMB (Right Mouse Button) and it slows down time. This is extremely helpful and in most situations extremely vital to your safety and ability to live.

One thing that I ADORE in this game is the amount of weapons. From a Shotgun to even a Katana, each weapon is unique and will help you in it's own way. Some enemies are best tailored to certain weapons and some can be destroyed with all types. This shows a sign of a good game when the player has multiple choices as to what they want to use to defeat certain enemies, meanwhile challenging themself to try it with harder or lesser used weapons.

Feeling like the game could just a little bit of "OOMPH"? How about you ramp up the difficulty with the different difficulty options! Each option is still hard in it's own right, so you don't have to worry about picking a difficulty and thinking that you're forced to play it for the rest of the game, whilst steamrolling the game.

If anything, I could say that this game is honestly one of the hardest games I've ever played. And I would be telling the truth 100%. This game is tough as nails, but I still find myself yearning to play it just knowing that I could beat the game in a harder difficulty, or even just play with a whole different weapon choice. Even once you've beaten the main game, Arcade Mode will have you coming back for more. Arcade Mode is honestly harder than Campaign mode for one simple reason; You have to beat the game with one life. Yeah, I know, hell. It's amazing fun all the same, and if you make a mistake you can remember it for the next time you play!

Enough about my undying, adoring love of the gameplay itself and onto my undying love of the art of this game. Yeah, okay the game is pixelated and that's totally fine! There's nothing wrong with pixel art when done RIGHT. And boy oh boy did this game do it right. 

Firstly, you should note how gorgeous the sceneary is in this game. The backdrops are so well done and show an obvious amount of time and detail which has been poured into it. Each character and enemy alike are so well done that you can find yourself staring at how brilliant the sprites actually are.

Weapon art is done incredibly well, each weapon differing from the other and allowing you to actually see how different the weapons are from one another.

Alright, onto the final stretch, trust me.

The music in this game is brillant. It's amazingly upbeat and cheerful and can make you just want to buy the OST for friends upon friends.

Now, for the bit I've been waiting to talk about for quite a while. The places where this game kinda falls short.

Okay, look. This game isn't perfect but that doesn't take away from how good the game actually is, so take these little nitpicks with a grain of salt.

The controls:
 - There's a damn good reason I didn't put the controls in something that I enjoy. It's because I don't really like the controls with this game when using keyboard. Controller, as recommended by many, many other reviewers, is totally agreed with by me. I mean, don't get me wrong, the game is 100% playable with mouse and keyboard, but it's just a bit rough. For me, at least.
Achievements:
 - Some achievements feel super, super, hard to get. I'm all for a tough achievement but I don't like games that have achievements which make me curse the game itself.

Apart from that, everything else in this game is pretty great!




[b]Enjoy the review? Please consider checking out my curator! I recommend many games similar to this one.[/b] http://steamcommunity.com/groups/JacksGamesOfChoice#curation

19719683.review:
TL;DR: A fast-paced action platformer of 16-bit retro looks, [i]Bleed[/i] is one of those games that anyone who likes platformers should play.

In [i]Bleed[/i], a girl named Wryn wants to become the ultimate videogame hero. She sets out to beat all the previous heroes of the old times. Her super powers? Bullet time and excessive amounts of fire power.

Retro in looks, the game is set in the vague year 21XX and the graphics are reminiscent of 16-bit era. It works in [i]Bleed[/i]'s favour as the silly and colourful enemies and bosses have a refreshingly distinctive look to them. The soundtrack is plainly awesome. I love how the tracks have been carefully chosen to fit all scenarios; especially the last level's soundtrack was simply intense.

With colourful artwork come the silly looking enemies. Cats and flying ooze blops litter the levels. The bosses include worms, a slug and a dragon among other silly things. While the common enemies are simple and predictable, all bosses have at least three special attack patterns that get faster and more intensive the higher the difficulty setting becomes.

[h1]Legacy of Max Payne and Matrix[/h1]

The fast-paced gameplay of gunslinging and attacks coming from all directions at once is alleviated by Wryn's super power: she can slow down time at will (or at the click of a button). Bullet time renders many impossible looking situations manageable, even easy, but the twist is that the bullet time energy is limited and replenishes only when not used. Wryn can do three consequential dives in the air (like double jumps but better), a feat that becomes really useful when dodging attacks while using bullet time.

There are nine different weapons to try, two to start with and the rest to unlock through experience (gained by winning levels or challenges) and beating levels. You start with dual pistols and rocket launcher, and since there are no reloads it's rather common to just run through a level with the fire button down all the way.

One can buy e.g. a flamethrower, a sniper laser rifle and a sword that can be used to ricochet bullets back at enemies. All weapons are unique and useful in their own way but some require more practice than others. You can only equip two weapons at a time, which is a bummer since often you'd like to use 3 different ones in a given boss fight. Though weapons can be changed by going to escape menu, it's still a break in the flow that is bad in a fast-paced game like this.

I played [i]Bleed[/i] without problems using keyboard and mouse but controller is recommended (I have one but I still preferred K+M). Controller enables more accurate dodges and movement while mouse allows more accurate targeting so both are totally viable settings. At least one controller is required to play local co-op, which I sadly didn't get to try out.

[h1]Challenging but not Nintendo-hard[/h1]

Mastering bullet time, dodging and useful weapon combinations are the key to winning the boss battles and especially when playing through the Arcade Mode where you also have to manage the combometer (for highscores and for certain weapons), done by hitting enemies and not getting hit yourself.

[i]Bleed[/i] has seven levels that can in principle be beaten in an hour or so but the four difficulty levels add a lot to replayability unless you just started out to torture yourself through it with the Very Hard mode.

While in Story Mode there are check points and you can play any section as often as you wish, the Arcade Mode makes you play through the game without a single death. As your health bar does not get replenished between levels this puts [i]Bleed[/i] into the category for extremely difficult games to complete 100%. Nevertheless it is almost completely fair, so you know every mistake is your own.

I needed tens of tries to survive through Hard and Very Hard difficulties in Arcade Mode but it felt very satisfactory once I did it. As such take my 21 hours to 100% completion with a grain of salt - it could take you a bit less time if you were good or very much more to 100% [i]Bleed[/i] depending on your skills. You might even find it to be nearly impossible. That said, [i]Bleed[/i] is a very good action platformer, and if you like the genre it's one of those must-buy games.

19553392.review:
This game mega took me by surprise. While a limited 'bullet time' power has been explored time and time again by games of many different genres, I don't honestly think I've ever seen it implemented as cleanly and effectively as in Bleed. The game allows you up to three mid-air dashes, which can be performed in any direction and steered to a very precised degree. Normally the high speed and intensity of the game's action makes it difficult to properly utilise this mechanic to avoid the almost bullet-hell like hazards of each level, but that's where the bullet time comes in. Each level is, in addition to being very creative, extremely well suited to testing your ability to find the perfect moment to slow down time and use your air dashes to carefully weave in and out of obstacles, all while trying to deal maximum damage to the enemies in your way with a variety of weapons.
In addition to the well crafted levels, each boss is highly unique and a tonne of fun to fight. You're unlikely to beat any of them on your first try, but none of them ever feel unfair or cheap. 

My only complaints about the game are in the nitpicky details. I'm personally not a fan of spritework with coloured outlines, as I think it gives too much of a pillow-shade look to the characters. I can't say anything from the soundtrack sticks out as particularly memorable either. Generally speaking the weapon balance was a little off, with some of the unlockable weapons being downright useless, and most were just generally worse or less universally appropriate than the  default loadout, so you'll unfortunately probably go through most of the game without bothering to switch out. 

Overall though I'd absolutely recommend this to anyone who into difficult games that require quick thinking and precise movements and aiming. I've already enjoyed Bleed more than enough for my money's worth after two full playthroughs (first on hard and then on very hard), and I absolutely plan to go back and try and get an S-rank on each boss!

19359392.review:
First off, let me start by saying that this is one of the best platformers I have ever experienced. Now to the nitty-gritty stuff:

PROS

- Great game mechanic
- Controls are on point
- Unique and new play style make it all the more fun
- Awesome 8-bit (I think) graphics
- Pretty good story
- Terrific jumping and gunning system
- Fast-moving, fluid movement that feels good
- Overall good layout in general
- Soundtrack is amazing

CONS

- Definitely too short
- Does not have enough replayability (the sense of replayability comes from beating each level on one of four difficulties)
- Weapon mechanics are WAY unbalanced (the Dual Pistols are, in most situations, the best)
- Should have had more 'meat' to its bones (as I said, more levels, as well as possibly a more extensive shop and upgrades system)

CONCLUSION

An overall great game. It nails the 8-bit (I think) graphic style and layout. The control style is one of the best and most obscure I have seen. The other character variations and modes are not overly appealing to come back to. Main things to work on is game content, as I completed the initial game in just under three hours.

Definitely a great buy!

像素风格的横版射击游戏,风格简单爽快,主角的快速闪避和多种武器的组合搭配,给游戏增加了不少灵活性
故事模式的难度并不算太高,过了一个房间(或"区域")后死亡也是从这个地方开始,Boss战失败时可以直接重新来,省却了重复打小怪的时间,而关卡结束时获得的分数可用于购买新的武器或升级,不同的武器风格各异,至少轮流着用不会厌倦......因此总共7个关卡里除了每一关最后的Boss战,前面的小怪反倒显得有点"凑数"了,并没有给我留下太多的印象,反倒是每个Boss设计的都不错.
在通关后的Extra(不过通关前也有,但我还没来得及看一下有什么,就把故事模式通关了......)可以选择Boss Rush,看来作者也是希望玩家能重复挑战Boss,这个设计挺不错的,而且还可以设置同时对决1-3个Boss,简直是丧心病狂.其他还有1命通关的模式等等
作为一款小游戏质量还是挺不错的,缺点就在于剧情完全可以忽略,音乐质量一般般,没什么抓耳的原声,以及流程稍短,1~2小时就可以通关(但我是挺喜欢这一点的,不知道各位怎么想....)

J'ai jamais été trop fan des jeux qui font rétro, mais celui-là, je dois avouer qu'il est vraiment pas mal.
J'ai eu du mal à démarrer, les contrôles me semblaient étranges, mais une fois le premier niveau passé, on remarque une très nette progression. Du coup le reste du jeu se laisse engloutir. Il est pas très long mais chaque niveau est spécifique, avec plusieurs boss dans chacun d'entre eux, tous plus originaux les uns que les autres.

C'est pas le genre de jeu où on bat le dernier boss et c'est fini, celui là est relativement cours mais propose une très bonne rejouabilité, et on se surprend à le refaire indéfiniment pour débloquer tous les succès.

En bref, un jeu cours et très dynamique, avec des tirs, des explosions, du ralenti et de l'esquive à profusion, où on retourne très volontier.
